items.title: 11591 OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D with duplicated pages

items.content_html:
This PR adds details for OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D. The approach for documenting this interface is to minimize duplication, adding an index.md document for the OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D object that references methods and properties that it inherits instead of adding new pages:

tree

/files/en-us/web/api/offscreencanvasrenderingcontext2d/index.md
├── commit
│   └── index.md
└── index.md # mostly references /files/en-us/web/api/canvasrenderingcontext2d

Note: Do not merge while in draft state
items.title: 11591 OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D

items.title: Update index.md

items.content_html:
…neral to match all cases

As we can pass a descriptor object that inherits from another object (not Object Object directly), then we should generalize the sentence to match all cases.

for ex:
function descriptorCreator(configurable) {
this.configurable = configurable ;
}
descriptorCreator.prototype.writable = true
Object.prototype.enumerable = true;

let descriptor = new descriptorCreator(true) ;
let obj = {}
Object.defineProperty(obj, "y",descriptor);

console.log(Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(obj, 'y')) // {value: undefined, writable:true, enumerable:true, configurable:true}

//here writable is true (not default = not false) because it is inherited from the descriptorCreator object as it exists in the descriptor object prototype chain
// the same for enumerable as Object object also in the descriptor object prototype chain and no objects comes after in this chain shadows this value
// descriptor -> descriptorCreator -> Object

so we should here freeze descriptorCreator.prototype object, and Object.prototype object

Summary

Motivation

Supporting details

items.content_html:
Summary

  • I have added alt attributes to a handful of items in the content

Motivation

  • Adding the alt attribute to the image displays the value of alt attribute when the respective image fails to load rather than leaving the space blank. It is also read aloud by the screen readers when there is an image to describe the user about the image.

Supporting details

@estelle has collected the list of images from the documentation that do not have the alt attribute. link to the spreadsheet

Related issues

  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error

items.content_html:
Summary

Motivation

Fix #18764

Any duplicated content is a maintenance hassle and may be confusing to readers as well. Condensing them in the same place improves visibility.

This decision is further motivated by the addition of the "exceptions" section. If we don't do the deduplication, people won't be reading the TypedArray constructor page, and they won't know about the exception info. I don't want to duplicate that section just for visibility.

Supporting details

Related issues

  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Deduplicate TypedArray ctor param description, add exceptions

items.content_html:
This PR attempts to fix the apparently random committer used when the scripts/update-interface-data via interface-updater github workflow runs.

It adds a committer name an author.

See #20014 (comment) for the report of the oddity.
items.title: Add committer to interfacedata-updater workflow

Fixes #13749.

This attempts to clarify the description of event bubbling and capture, especially to make it clearer that capture is the non-default option.
items.title: Rework event bubbling and capture

items.content_html:
Although the current description says;
"You can only change the margins, orphans, widows, and page breaks of the document", but after testing, I found out that only the margin can be changed in the @page at-rule.
Maybe, all the features in the official spec have not been implemented yet? But, this is a small change I think would be useful to all devs that come across this and try it out for the first time.

Summary

It changes the description that says @page can only change the margins, orphans, widows, and page breaks of the document to only the margin can be changed.

Motivation

I came across this at-rule because I was preparing an article for a blog, but after testing I found out that only the margin can be changed. I think other devs that come across this won't waste their time wondering why the other properties were not showing any visible effect

Supporting details

The official documentation says a lot more can be changed, but, those changes also don't have any visible effect after testing. I think implementation for those properties is yet to be done in all UAs.
This is the official doc - https://drafts.csswg.org/css-page/#at-page-rule

Related issues

Not applicable

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: [Correction] Only margin can be changed in @page

items.content_html:
Summary

The "Accessibility concerns" section of the list-style-type page is out of date, and I think the same section in the list-style page could be more clear. Additionally, these pages are inconsistent with each other. This PR addresses these issues.

Motivation

I personally was a bit confused by the accessibility information on these two pages and, after doing some reading and testing on my own, thought I might be able to help clarify and provide some updates.

On the list-style page, I've updated the "Accessibility concerns" section to:

  • Clarify that Safari's behavior is intentional
  • Clarify that adding any pseudo-content before list items will restore list semantics. I was personally uncertain whether only zero-width spaces or images had this effect previously, and thought that other readers might be similarly unsure
  • Make sure that both <ul> and <ol> are mentioned any place where just one was mentioned previously, because Safari's behavior affects both
  • Add more examples
  • Add a link to the relevant WebKit Bugzilla bug
  • Update the link that references WCAG 2.0 to version 2.1

On the list-style-type page, I've updated the "Accessibility concerns" section to defer to the same section of the list-style page. I'm hopeful that this will make it easier to keep these sections in sync with each other, since they address the same issue. I chose to point the content on list-style-type to same on list-style, and not the opposite direction, because one of the provided workarounds involves list-style-image.

Supporting details

The list-style-type page references VoiceOver and list-style-type: none, but it would seem that this article has been updated since the information was added to MDN.

The aforementioned article and MDN's list-style page both reference "Fixing" Lists, which is a helpful source of information on this subject.

I found Bug #170179 | WebKit Bugzilla to be informative here, especially the test case attachment provided by James Craig in Comment 1.

I also manually tested both the original accessibility concern and each workaround given with Safari version 15.6.1 and VoiceOver on desktop to confirm that they behave as stated in this content.

Related issues

I wasn't able to find any related or similar Issues or Pull Requests.

Metadata

This PR...

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Update list-style and list-style-type accessibility concerns

Fixes to CSS Font Loading API following addition of worker support in FF104 (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1072107).

I think this is all good. But need to test the worker global scope example code.

Related docs work in #18769
items.title: CSS Font Loading API fixes - FF104

items.content_html:
FF104 added CanvasRenderingContext2D.fontKerning andOffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D.fontKerning in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1778908

The docs for CanvasRenderingContext2D.fontKerning were added in #19859 - waiting on the offscreen ones.

Other docs work for this can be tracked in #18772
